DOC.brief_summary: EMPACT is the first attempt to comprehensively evaluate the current emergency care of acute chest pain from a regional representative sample in China.Findings will allow new opportunities to facilitate the clinical quality improvements and ultimately reduce the mortality and health care burden in patients with acute chest pain. It also will help to establish a regional network and database for further research and performance improvement.
DOC.brief_title: The Evaluation and Management of Patients With Acute Chest Pain in China
DOC.criteria: Any patient aged 18 or older, who admitted to the EDs of the collaborating hospitals within 24h from onset of symptoms was regarded as eligible if he/she had one or two of the following features: chief complaint of acute chest pain, initially diagnosed ACS. The main exclusion criteria were chest pain caused by trauma, rheumatic diseases or cancer, transferred from another grade II or grade III hospital, and present to the ED again within 30 days after initial enrollment. Informed consent for inclusion and followup contact was obtained from the patients at enrollment.
